page.title: 17Changing Times in Bugbrooke
page.content: We asked some older people what it was like in 1945. There were 3 shops-2 grocers and a butchers.You couldn't buy what you wanted because of rationing.This also meant that clothes,which were hard to get anyway,had to last longer. There were no air-raid shelters and the only raid was by the wharf.Windows were blacked out every night. Cars were mainly owned by businesses and none of the new estates were built so Bugbrooke was very much smaller. There were two pubs as now. The mill which had been standing for hundreds of years was burnt down which is why all the buildings are modern. (There were 2 mills on the site in 1085.) There has never been a railway station or a market.
